result.header: Panel discussion: "The Model Minority Stereotype and Asian American Masculinity in a Post-Truth, #MeToo, #BLM Moment"
result.summary: Join the School of Urban Education for a panel discussion of the model minority stereotype and Asian American masculinity though personal and professional lenses.
Celebrate the Career Center's completion of powerful career education videos. Watch the videos and meet the producers.

November is open enrollment month for health insurance. Are you covered? Metropolitan State University staff, faculty and students are invited to join Healthcare and Wellness Services during information sessions throughout November.

November is open enrollment month for health insurance. Are you covered? Metropolitan State University staff, faculty and students are invited to join Healthcare and Wellness Services during information sessions throughout November.

The Hmong Student Organization (HSO) will be hosting a workshop-centered Outspoken event Nov. 13. The event will focus on the diversity and differences that can be seen, heard and felt within our communities, as well as how these differences surfaced and how the world has reacted.
The Master of Business Administration (MBA) offers prospective graduate students opportunities to gather information about getting an advance degree from Metropolitan State University.

The Master of Management Information Systems (MMIS) information session offers prospective graduate students opportunities to gather information about getting an advance degree from Metropolitan State University. The MMIS program prepares you for a career in Management of Information Technology (IT) field.

The Neighborhood House will be hosting seven free produce distribution events at Metropolitan State University this harvest season. Between November and May, Neighborhood House will be sharing fresh fruits, vegetables and other vital food with anyone in the Saint Paul community needing food support.

result.header: “We Are Anishinaabe: Honoring Textile Traditions” exhibit
result.summary: Metropolitan State University Gordon Parks Gallery presents "We Are Anishinaabe: Honoring Textile Traditions," a group exhibition of Native American design and crafted art. The exhibit will be on display Oct. 31 through Nov. 22.

The Doctor of Business Administration (DBA) information session offers prospective graduate students opportunities to gather information about getting an advanced degree from Metropolitan State University. The DBA program prepares you to be a successful, ethical business leader in complex and changing organizations.
Join Metropolitan State University's Psychology Club for Movie Night in Founders Hall's Film Space. This Movie Night event will feature the film Inside Out.

TC3 invites speakers to connect with students and the community on a variety of topics as part of the Pro-SPEAK Series. This will be first of three networking events open to the public and interested students, regardless of major or college.

Metropolitan State University students and alumni are invited to attend the Natural Sciences Careers infosession to hear professionals in state and federal agencies present information on careers in natural resources management and environmental stewardship.

Metropolitan State University's Nursing Student Organization (NSO) is hosting a self-care event to help students, staff and faculty relax and de-stress. Attendees will have the opportunity to network with peers and healthcare professionals, all while learning about the importance of making time to take care of oneself.

result.header: Lunchtime with the Saint Paul Chamber Orchestra
result.summary: You'll feel as if you are on stage with the musicians when three digital performances featuring the Saint Paul Chamber Orchestra are screened with high fidelity stereo sound and big screen presentation in Metropolitan State University's Film Space auditorium.

Whether you want to try out a new video game system or show off your gaming skills, Metropolitan State University invites you to game out every third Tuesday of each month. Those interested should meet at the Student Lounge in the university’s Library and Learning Center. Games will be available to play on both classic and new game systems. Board games will also be available.

The holiday season is fast approacing, so the Dayton's Bluff library invites the community to take a break before the Thanksgiving frenzy by attending the Break for Board Games event. This is a free event that will feature board games and snacks in the Teen Area of the library.

result.header: The Haute Dish's fall 2017 literature reading
result.summary: Metropolitan State University invites the community to celebrate their love of poetry, prose and the arts at the Haute Dish's fall 2017 literature reading.

Internship Information Sessions will include information about policies and procedures, strategies for locating internship sites and instructions on completing internship forms. University students and alumni are welcome to attend.

Design a poster to display your research projects at Metropolitan State University annual Student Poster Conference. The conference is a chance for students to present their scholarship from within and outside the classroom, including research projects, essays and secondary research.
Once a month, students are guided through an exploration of a specific field of inquiry in a hands-on laboratory. December's science theme is magic sand.

Dayton's Bluff Library invites the community to attend a Star Party. The party will allow attendees to explore the moon, constellations, planets, galaxies and more. The event will feature Mike Lynch, meteorologist at WCCO Radio.
